sub_title: Global Business Director and general manager Latex Binders , Trinseo
summary:
Customer utility driver, energetic, analytical, participative leadership style, open and direct. 
Extensive exposure in Europe, USA, exposure to Asia.
Competences and proven track record in: Turnaround, Aligning, focusing, structuring and energizing the whole organization towards strategy execution, Pricing, Sourcing, 
In-depth knowledge of the following industries: Chemical Industry, Adhesive Industry, Composite materials Industry, Paper industry, Paper and Packaging Wholesale.

profile_positions.description: Project management and consulting on strategy formulation, execution, market strategies, pricing and sourcing
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Global P&L responsibility, Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, Operations, Research and Development. Chair Global Business Management Team for Binders, turnover 1.3 billion US$ as part of Trinseo, a 4 billion$ chemicals company, NYSE noted (TSE), until June 2015 Private Equity owned,12 plants 2 global R&D centres, 3 regional application development centres.
Results:
-	Implemented a turnaround program repositioning the business from a latex producer in a declining market into a binder provider in a growth market.
-	Turned around a 5 year negative volume trend into growth.
-	Refocused the business organization to concentrate on higher margin, higher growth program.
-	Initiated a site consolidation program to reduce the numbers of sites from 12 to 8. Introduced a program to make all plants SA (styrene acrylic) capable.
-	Introduced a M&A strategy that is focused on adjacent diversification; Improving SA development and marketing competence. 2 initiatives are in implementation.
-	Executed a program to improve sourcing of other raw materials, generating more than 12MM$ in savings.
-	Working capital improvement initiatives resulted in reduction of DSO from 84 to 58 days in APAC.
-	Initiated margin improvement program in NAA and EMEA, generating 19MM$ additional margin.
-	EBITDA margin improved from 78MM$ (2015) to 125 MM$ (2017 guidance)
-      Co head of performance plastics division (Automotive and Electronics) for 4 months
profile_positions.title: Global Director Latex Binders (general manager)

profile_positions.description:
Full P&L responsibility for Switzerland, Benelux and France (sales 546 million euro) Corporate responsibility for Sales for Papyrus, Private Equity owned. 1.8 billion Euro wholesaler in paper and packaging supplies. Hands on management as MD or CEO in Benelux (6 months -200people), France (1yr-200people) and Switzerland (1.5yr -250 people) on an acting basis.
Results:
-	Improved sales performance of more than 1000 sales positions and introduced pricing excellence (profitability analysis, customer portfolio analysis and execution) with a total potential of 50 Million in 2014 of which 50% is already realized in 2012. On time. Prime focus was Germany (400+ sales employees)
-	Executed a restructuring project for Benelux and France to create a regional structure and lower costs (-35%).
-	Acquired and integrated one company in a high growth area (Large Format Printing) in Belgium. Growth after one year of combined sales 16%. Successful introduction into Netherlands.
-	Introduced a corporate E-business project costing 8 million euro and generating 10-12 million improvement with the objective to generate a new business model to sell paper.
-	Net working capital improved 40% over 3 years as a % of turnover in the West.
-	Margins up 8 million over 2 years despite 10% market volume decline in the West.
profile_positions.title: Senior Vice President Europe West and Member Management Board

profile_positions.description:
Full P&L responsibility, Sales, Marketing, R&D, Operations.for EMEA. Member EC with global responsibility for HBFuller, NYSE noted. 1.5 billion US$ sales in industrial adhesives. EMEA sales 440 million us$ (2008).

Results:
-	Operating result before corporate allocations improved from 22mln Euro (2005) to 36 million (2006) to 42 million 2007 to 34 million in 2008. Improved ROS performance in comparison with 3 peers (Henkel, Sika, Forbo ) in 2006 from negative 4%  to zero in 08 and positive in 09.
-	Gap organic growth performance versus peers reduced from 7% to 2% in 08 and positive 09.
-	Executed Price Increase Program that resulted in 50% of Profit increase corrected for volume losses (segmented oriented pricing), introduced rightsizing program for the remaining 50% of profit increase (closed 2 water based plants.) using LSS tools.
-	Successfully closed acquisition and expansion in Egypt and successfully closed an entry acquisition in flexible packaging in Germany.
-	Reduced working capital with more then 20% in the first half year of 2009 as % of sales,
-	Consolidated 5 development centres and manufacturing into Germany.
profile_positions.title: Vice President EMEA and Member Executive Board

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Sales and Market Strategy within M-real Office Papers (900mln euro turnover) Part of Office Papers Division management. The division has 4 paper mills, 3 pulp mills. Responsible for steering R&D. 

Results:
-	Market share grew from 15 to 17%.
Organized business around customer needs/ channels (Resellers/ Merchants/Oem/Converters.)
-	Closed 2 partnership agreements with global resellers, Office Depot, Corporate Express, resulting in 100 ktons extra volume ie 75 mln euro turnover.
profile_positions.title: Senior Vice President Office Papers

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Operating Income Structural Resins Business Unit (300 mln euro in turnover). M. Chairman of the Operating Team of Structural Resins ( ie Business Unit Manager) . The BU exists of 5 dedicated sites/plants, 7 Customer Competence Centers and 2 development centers, all in Europe. Managed 3 JV’s; 2 in Germany and one in Poland.
profile_positions.title: Business Director Composite Resins

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for 800 million guilders in purchasing directly and 4.6 billion guilders functionally. Head of central purchasing department chemicals DSM (12 people).
-	Introduced a coordination system on purchasing between Business Groups, addressing the needs of the   business to stay in charge but exploiting synergy between the BG’s.
-	Realized with his department 68 million guilders structural out of pocket savings on the direct purchases on an annual basis.
profile_positions.title: Director Corporate  Sourcing Chemicals and Raw Materials

skills: general management, strategy formulation and execution
